awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase I:  Tackling Healthcare’s Paradoxes: Quality Patient Care, Provider Workflow, and Data Security
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact /commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project is to provide a new tool for physicians to potentially automate the preparation of insurance documentation and facilitate claim building which may help to lower provider costs and increase patient access to and quality of care. Physicians can spend up to 50% of their time performing non-clinical tasks which have also been associated with physician burnout, a psychological condition known to result in medical errors, lower quality of care, higher costs, and overall poorer patient outcomes. The proposed innovation is a proprietary algorithm that leverages data to automate the completion of insurance form documentation. This new technology aims to resolve workflow bottlenecks and complement existing clinical workflows by delivering a simpler provider experience by streamlining the preparation of medical form documentation.  

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project aims to develop a machine learning-enabled electronic medical record access toolset designed to automate and streamline the preparation of insurance form documentation. A major issue in the US healthcare system is the process through which healthcare providers seek reimbursement through health insurance companies. Filing claims and seeking prior authorizations on procedures or tests from insurance companies is a manual process that is slow and error prone, often resulting in delays in treatment or even rejection, jeopardizing patient health, and resulting in higher costs. Designed for physicians, the proposed technology will facilitate claim building using pre-trained natural language models to extract medical text and relationships from various inputs including patient and provider demographic information as well as payer information, clinical taxonomy, functional features, and relations.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
Project Outcomes Report

The ParaDoc’s platform is designed to address one of the major inefficiencies in the US healthcare system. In many primary care and healthcare organizations, identifying and closing care gaps (discrepancies between best practices and actual received care) is still a largely a manual, labor-intensive process prone to errors, often resulting in delays in treatment or even rejection, jeopardizing patient health and resulting in higher costs. By eliminating care gaps, healthcare organizations are able to improve their quality scores and increase reimbursement, as well as improve patient outcomes and satisfaction.

ParaDocs Health is developing a machine-learning-enabled toolset designed to automate and streamline administrative tasks across the clinical workflow. Through its flagship product, “ParaDocs Relay,” ParaDocs provide clinics with a comprehensive intelligence platform that reads the electronic health record and provides key metrics and actionable insights on the current patient population, alongside automation features that enable clinicians to directly write into the record and generate reports directly to health insurance. In combination, these features reduce the need for administrative labor while also providing key insights into population health, disease prevalence, care gaps, and patient risk profiles.

In Phase I, ParaDocs Health made significant advancements on the platform, providing a robust foundation for future applications and real-world implementation. Construction of the system was made possible through a partnership with a large health system which provided access to over 60,000 patient records across six states. These data were used to construct our initial natural language processing pipeline that supports the implementation of our ParaDocs Relay platform. Notable achievements include the development of an advanced system for secure clinical data transfer, accurate insurance coding, and seamless electronic health record integration capabilities. A pilot study of the technology demonstrated 224-fold increase in time savings compared to standard practices for insurance form documentation.


Last Modified: 01/03/2025
Modified by: Omar Mohtar
